title: A Study of joan's convivtion to be God's emissary in bernard shaw Saint Joan
abstract: This thesis is a study of Bernard shaw's great history play. Saint Joan. Joan believes that she had been chosen by God to set France free From English oppression in 1429 where the story discussed about the Engllish force in France. Because of her conviction to be God's emissary, she has to face the obatacles and consequences, which later bring her into her death. In this study, the thesis writer hignliyhts the idea of Joan's conviction to be God's emissary in the fifteenth century as repealed through the main female character, Joan. The thesis writer intends to find the reasons of Joan's conviction to be God's emissary and the consequences of her conviction. The thesis writer uses literary approach, which is the theory of characterization to analyze Joan's character traits that influenced her conviction to God and theory of conflict to reveal Joan's death. In the analysis the thesis writer finds that Joan character traits that are persistence and ignorant play a big role in her way to be God's emissary; moreover, her character traits also give her courage to face all the consequences such as her death. In conclusion, the thesis writer finds that a conviction can change something that seems impossible to be possible.
contributors: Jenny Mochtar Djundjung (Advisor 1); Stefanus Suprayitno (Examination Committee 1)
